text: the important question isn't when did I
start drawing it's when did you stop
drawing and more importantly why I think
I started drawing on sidewalks because I
had successfully failed to make art
anywhere else art that's on the street
and especially art that's underneath
your feet it's part of your regular life
it's something you see without having
expected to see art today self-doubt
should never be allowed to win we are
all brilliant artists under the age of
five this self-doubt is something we
learn but also to let people know that
they have every right to throw down
their pencils and never draw a picture
again because it might be that their
form of creative expression is sculpting
or dancing or baking or telling a joke
really well or stacking sugar cubes in a
purse iswe just for the sheer joy of it
and that all counts it's all creativity
and it's all good for your soul
[Music]
science is how we solve problems but art
is how we cope with them which is good
because science often takes a long time
to solve them and in the meantime we
have to cope my brain is constantly
trying to help it's trying to think its
way out of this situation by thinking of
all the stuff I should be doing and all
the stuff I might be doing wrong but it
makes me absolutely miserable so I think
creativity serves among its many
purposes the ability to make that part
of your brain shut up just stop because
it's trying but it's not helping
